bioghist.p: O.E. (Orvil Edward) Mirtz (1902-1993) was a 1931 graduate of Princeton Seminary. Following his graduation, he spent several years in Hainan, China as a missionary. After his return to the United States, he was a teacher of mathematics and a house parent at the Mount Hermon School for Boys in Northfield, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers and photographs from Mirtz's time serving as a missionary in Hainan, China, between 1931 and 1935. Materials include a photograph album with images of village activities, dwellings, weddings, sporting events, students, soldiers, Loi and Miao villagers, rice cultivation, kites, and Mirtz's pony "Baby." The collection also includes correspondence from Mirtz; typed reports and notes on various aspects of culture in Hainan; notices for his sermons (in Chinese); a chart of statistics of the China Mission of the Presbyterian Church in USA, 1933; photographs of students and staff of the Pitkin School and the Lingnan Branch School; poems, songs, and children's rhymes in Chinese (some transliterated into Roman script); sketches of kites; a floor plan of Lingnan Branch School; a broadside depicting Jesus' ministry (in Chinese); prints and ephemera; and newspaper clippings (in English).
